notes.text: Mathematical foundations including statistics, theoretical computer science, and algorithm analysis.

items.title: MATH 525 - Statistics I
items.subtitle: Essentials of statistics with emphasis on data science, covering statistical modeling, Bayesian inference and computation, and approaches used in machine learning and data analysis.

items.title: MATH 526 - Statistics II
items.subtitle: Advanced statistical methods building on Statistics I, covering multivariate analysis, experimental design, nonparametric methods, and advanced regression techniques.

items.title: COSC 317 - Honors Discrete Structures
items.subtitle: Introduction to Set Theory, Graph Theory, and Logic & Proof strategies as the principles of software programming and design. Application of proof techniques to prove correctness of algorithms.

items.title: COSC 312 - Algorithm Analysis and Automata
items.subtitle: This course is an introduction to the Theory of Computation, the logic of computation with respect to machines as well as the implications related to current computing challenges and limits.

items.title: COSC 493 - Advanced Automata Theory
items.subtitle: Working on the development of a Turing Machine to be used as educational aid to students. The pre-existing version of the simulator was written in Java and various improvements, additions, and modifications were made to it in order to make it more user-friendly and efficient.
